alert.note: Alert for Inland Cameron; Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 20 at 4:06AM CST until January 21 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain and sleet possible. Very cold wind chills possible. Light icing will result in very slippery conditions on sidewalks, with black ice on roads and bridges/overpasses, including during the morning commute on Friday. Wind chills could range from around 20 to 30 degrees. * WHERE...Southern Hidalgo and Inland Cameron County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, 3 AM to 12 PM Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, 9 PM this evening to 12 PM Friday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 30 minutes to exposed skin.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of ice are expected This will make travel very hazardous or impossible. A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and the wind will combine to create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
